cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast tonight, then forecast to arc north across Louisiana on Thursday and into Arkansas and the mid-Mississippi Valley Friday before turning east-northeast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border between Port Arthur, TX and Lake Charles, LA
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system remains inland well south of the port)
cyclone.hours_of_strike: 0 (no direct strike expected at Kansas City Port Authority, MO)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no watches posted for Missouri or the mid-Mississippi Valley
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from San Luis Pass, TX to Intracoastal City, LA; Tropical-Storm Warning eastward to the mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts (Sea Rim State Park, TX to Intracoastal City, LA)
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: SHREVEPORT LA (closest listed point to Kansas City in probability table)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (inland port on the Missouri River)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty southerly winds possible late Fri as remnant low passes to the southeast, generally below tropical-storm force
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected due to inland location
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Friday into early Saturday with 2–4 inches possible, localized flooding in low-lying river terminals
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk on Friday as the remnant circulation tracks through the mid-Mississippi Valley
